info.michaelkohler.helpertools.io

Class FileWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.michaelkohler.helpertools.io.FileWriter

  • public class FileWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    A |FileWriter| writes data to a file. Once a |FileWriter| is instantiated it can only used for this path and this specific appending option. If you need to write to an other file, you need to create a new instance of the object.
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Michael Kohler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileWriter(java.lang.String aPath, boolean aAppend)
      Constructor which sets the path and whether the message should be appended to the file or not.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void writeFile(java.lang.String aText)
      Writes the specified text to the file specified in the _path variable.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • FileWriter

        aAppend - whether the message should be appended or not
